poem:
**Fraudulence**

In silence the world spins,   
a masquerade of pedigrees—  
souls cloaked in doubt,   
struggling beneath accolades.  
In the stillness of applause,  
an echo of heartbeats falters:  
selves undisguised, unseen.   
In earthly disguise,   
the truth lies hidden,  
a whisper among shadows  
that fade,  
unclaimed.  
Truth wears its mask,  
reflected endlessly  
in the solitude of the self.
